description: Aviation Stories told by pilots, recounting the triumphs, failures, and lessons learned from their aviation adventures.  For more information check out our web site http://www.avstry.com.
title: Aviation Story

episodes.title: Avstry 20 - Jeff Skiles
episodes.description: Jeff Skiles Co-Pilot, US Airways FLight 1549, The Miracle On The Hudson.

episodes.title: Avstry 17 - Carl Schwerman
episodes.description: Carl Schwerman tells us about three generations of flying his T-34

episodes.title: Avstry S4 - Jerry Sleger
episodes.description: For over twenty years Jerry has been at Oshkosh AirVenture with his one man band.

episodes.title: Avstry 18 - Brad Deckert
episodes.description: Brad tells us about the history of his TBM Avenger.

episodes.title: Avstry 16 - Jeb Burnside
episodes.description: Jeb Burnside from the UCAP Podcast.  Tells us about his time in working in Congress, his time as Editor-In-Chief at Avweb and Aviation Safety and some reflections about UCAP.

episodes.title: Avstry 15 - Junkers 52-3M
episodes.description: Uwe and Cedric tells us about 1939 Junkers 52-3M  they brought from Europe.

episodes.title: Avstry 14 - Aluminum Overcast
episodes.description: Dick Lewis, tells us the history of the EAA's B-17 Aluminum Overcast, and how you could sit in the best seat in the house.

episodes.title: Avstry 13 - Glacier Girl
episodes.description: Robert L. Cardin, tells us the history of the Lost Squadron, about how Glacier Girl was rescued from the ice of Greenland and returned to flying condition.

episodes.title: Avstry 12 - Cody Welch
episodes.description: Cody tells us about the EAA's Ford Tri-motor's history and your opportunity to ride this historical treasure.

episodes.title: Avstry 11 - Adam Smith
episodes.description: Adam tells us about the AOPA's Center to Advance the Pilot Community, as well as his time directing the EAA AirVenture Museum, and flying in Scotland.

episodes.title: Avstry 10b - Ransom Rideout
episodes.description: Ransom a World War II pilot serving in the Pacific Theater, is shot down in China!

episodes.title: Avstry 10a - Ransom Rideout
episodes.description: Ransom a World War II pilot serving in the Pacific Theater, tells us about his early days of flying, in the United States.

episodes.title: Avstry 9 - Kas Osterbuhr
episodes.description: Founder of Exosphere3d, Kas created a recreation of the US Airway's Flight 1549 Hudson River accident, volunteers as a member of the FAA FAST team and teaches for the Sport Air Workshop.

episodes.title: Avstry 8 - Neil Gaiman
episodes.description: Neil talks about how science fiction, becomes science fact, some reflections on Ray Bradbury, what he would un-invent and lastly some advice for the future.

episodes.title: Avstry s3 - Apollo 11
episodes.description: Special Episode 3, Apollo 11 Onboard Audio Highlights

episodes.title: Avstry 7b - Paul Suhler Part 2
episodes.description: Continuing our conversation, we hear about the B-58 Hustler, the Fish, KingFish, We also discuss the evolution of the A5 - A12 Project as well as details of the SR-71 Blackbird

episodes.title: Avstry 7a - Paul Suhler Part 1
episodes.description: We learn about the early days of the Archangel Project as well as the SR-71 Blackbird.  And how these aircraft were designed and build to penetrate deep into foreign territory and return with vital intelligence.

episodes.title: Avstry 6b - Max Trescott Part 2
episodes.description: Max Trescott, 2008's CFI of the Year talks continues his interview with discussing tellings us about winning CFI of the year, selecting an instructor, and EAA's Airventrue and we concludes with some thoughts about how pilots can look our for each other.

episodes.title: Avstry s2 - Empire State
episodes.description: Special Episode 2, The Plane that Flew Into the Empire State Building

episodes.title: Avstry 6a - Max Trescott Part 1
episodes.description: Max Trescott, 2008's CFI of the Year talks about getting his Multi Engine ATP Rating.  We also discuss some of the advantages of using a glass panel displays used in modern aircraft, as well as the Flying Doctors organization.

episodes.title: Avstry s1 - UCAP #300
episodes.description: Special Episode 1, is a celebrations of Uncontrolled Airspace 300th episode.  The fans speak.

episodes.title: Avstry 5 - Lynda Meeks
episodes.description: Lynda Meeks, Founder of Girls with Wings, tells us about in the US Army as a Huey Pilot, the Girls with Wings scholarship program and her feature film debut in Acrocamp.

episodes.title: Avstry 4 - Mike Busch
episodes.description: Mike Busch, the Savvy Aviator tells us about the early days of Avweb, his Savvy Aircraft Maintenance Management program, his aircraft maintenance webinar and announces the launch of the SavvyAnalysis website.

episodes.title: Avstry 3d - Alan Brown Part 4
episodes.description: Alan Brown, of the Lockheed Skunk Works concludes our conversation on the F-117 Nighthawk and some reflections on the Northrop B-2 Spirit and F-22 Raptor.

episodes.title: Avstry 3c - Alan Brown Part 3
episodes.description: Alan Brown, of the Lockheed Skunk Works continues with more stories working with Ben Rich on the F-117 Nighthawk, why it's the shape it is, how it got it's name, and why it's black.

episodes.title: Avstry 3b - Alan Brown Part 2
episodes.description: Alan Brown, of the Lockheed Skunk Works continues his discussion with his work on the Have Blue, Horton flying wing, U-2 "Dragon Lady" and F-117 nighthawk and research into stealth technology.

episodes.title: Avstry 3a - Alan Brown Part 1
episodes.description: Alan Brown, of the Lockheed Skunk Works tells us about the early days of his career, working on the F-104 Starfighter, Bristol Bloodhound surface to air missile, UGM-27 Polaris intercontinental ballistic missile.

episodes.title: Avstry 2 - Neil Brooks
episodes.description: Neil Brooks, tells us about his time in the Airforce serving with Strategic Air Command, and his time with United flying DC-6, DC-8's and 727.  We also talk about his experience  building his KitFox.

episodes.title: Avstry 1 - Gryphon McArthur
episodes.description: Gryphon McArthur from Ocean Air Flight Services, discusses what it takes to get a pilot's license, Light sport aircraft, and what you can do after you have your license.
